intro: Cullumia aculeata, commonly known as the prickly cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a serrated edge, while its stems are covered in small, sharp spines. Cullumia aculeata plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and provides nectar for various pollinators.
